title: Partner won't meet my friends
selftext: Hey Brevkasse. I've been with my boyfriend for almost a year, and he still hasn't met my friends. Every time I suggest it, he comes up with an excuse. title: Neighbors who keep parties until 4 a.m.
selftext: My downstairs neighbors throw parties almost every weekend. The music pumps, and people shout and scream on the balcony until late into the night. I have small children who wake up because of it. I've tried knocking on the door and asking them to turn it down, but they don't care. What do you do? Should you call the police, or is there another way to handle it?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is on his phone all the time
selftext: When my boyfriend and I are together, he is constantly on his phone. He scrolls through Instagram while we watch movies, checks the news while we eat, and answers messages while I talk to him. I feel ignored and de-prioritized. I have told him, but he thinks I'm overreacting. How can I get him to understand that it hurts me?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents will not accept my boyfriend
selftext: I have a boyfriend whom I am really happy with. The problem is that my parents don't like him. They don't think he's 'good enough' because he's a tradesman and doesn't have a university degree. They are cold and rejecting when he visits. It's so painful. Should I just accept it, or should I confront them?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I feel exploited at work
selftext: I am the type who always says yes. Yes to extra tasks, yes to staying longer, yes to helping colleagues. The result is that I am constantly overburdened and stressed, while others take their time off on schedule. I have difficulty saying no because I want to be a good colleague. But I can feel that I am burning out. How do you learn to set boundaries at the workplace?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend has started dating someone I don't like
selftext: My best friend has gotten a new boyfriend, whom I think is arrogant and unpleasant. He talks down to her and interrupts her all the time. She seems happy, but I am worried about her. Should I intervene and say my honest opinion, or should I keep my mouth shut and hope that she sees it herself? I am afraid of losing her if I criticize her choice.
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: How do you find motivation to eat healthy?
selftext: I know what I *should* eat, but when it comes to the actual part, I always choose the easy and unhealthy solution. Pizza, burger, sweets... The motivation to make a healthy salad just doesn't exist after a long workday. How do you other people find motivation to eat healthy in everyday life? Are there any tricks that make it easier?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it cheaper to shop in Germany?
selftext: I am considering taking a trip over the border to do a big shopping spree. Are there really that many savings on groceries such as soda, candy, meat, and cleaning supplies? Or will the savings be eaten up by fuel costs? What are your experiences, and which items are best to buy in Germany?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best gift for someone who 'doesn't want anything'?
selftext: My dad's birthday is coming up, and as always he says he doesn't want anything. That makes it impossible to find a gift! What do you give to the man who has everything (or says he has)? I would like to give something more personal than a bottle of wine or a book. Good ideas for the 'giftless' man are welcome!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People Who Don't Keep Distance in the Queue
selftext: Am I the only one who hates it when people stand right up against someone in the supermarket queue? I can feel their breath on my neck and see what they're typing on the card terminal. What happened to personal space? It's so unnecessary and intrusive. Give me just 50 cm of space, please!
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend doesn't want sex anymore
selftext: In the beginning of our relationship, my boyfriend and I had a fantastic sex life. But in the last year he has almost no desire. He always rejects me when I take the initiative, and says he is tired. I feel unattractive and rejected. I have tried to talk to him about it, but he just shuts down. What could be wrong, and what should I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: How do you handle Christmas when you are a child of divorce?
selftext: I am an adult now, but I still hate Christmas. It's a logistical nightmare having to split between my mother's and father's families. No matter what I do, there's always someone who gets disappointed. I just wish I could spend Christmas in one place, but I feel guilty. Are there other adult children of divorce who have found a good solution?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am afraid of speaking in front of other people
selftext: I have a job where I sometimes have to present something to my colleagues, and I hate it. My heart starts pounding, I sweat, and I stutter. I am so afraid of saying something stupid or freezing. It is starting to limit me in my career. Do you have any advice on how to overcome presentation anxiety?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: Is it okay to 'break up' with a friend?
selftext: I have a friend who drains my energy. He is always negative, constantly complains, and only talks about his own problems. I can't stand being with him anymore, because I always end up in a bad mood. But how do you end a friendship? Do you say it directly, or just let it slip into the sand? It feels so brutal.
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I can't sleep when there's a full moon
selftext: It may sound crazy, but I always sleep badly when there's a full moon. I lie down and turn and twist and can't find peace at all. I've read that it's a myth, but I experience it again and again. Are there others who feel the same way? And is there anything that helps?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: How do you set a budget that you actually stick to?
selftext: Every month I start with the best intentions. I set a nice budget in a spreadsheet, but after a week everything has slipped. I am too impulsive with my money and quickly lose sight of the big picture. Is there a foolproof method or an app that can help an economically undisciplined person like me keep track of money?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: Good advice to avoid food waste?
selftext: I am shocked over how much food we throw away at home. Vegetables that go bad, leftovers that get forgotten at the back of the fridge... I really want to get better at avoiding food waste, both for the environment and for the wallet. What are your best tips? Do you plan meals, use certain apps, or have a fixed 'leftover day'?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who talk in the cinema
selftext: Why is there always someone who feels the need to comment on the film while it's playing in the cinema? 'Hey, who was that?', 'Look, something is happening now!'. Keep your mouth shut! I paid to watch the film, not to hear your private commentary track. It ruins the whole experience. Show some respect for the others in the hall.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: I'm afraid of getting attached
selftext: I have been dating a guy for half a year, and he is everything I could wish for. Now he has started talking about the future and moving in together, and I'm panicking. I have a history of sabotaging good relationships as soon as they become too serious. I'm afraid of getting hurt. How do you learn to dare to commit and trust love?
label: Love & Dating

title: My husband won't help at home
selftext: I feel like I'm carrying all the household chores. I wash clothes, clean, shop, and cook while my husband sits on the sofa when he comes home from work. I also work full time. I've tried talking to him about it, but he thinks I'm better at it, and therefore it's 'easier' for me to do it. I'm about to explode. What do I do?
label: Family Dynamics

title: Feeling lonely at work
selftext: I work in an open office layout, but I feel incredibly lonely. My colleagues have small cliques, and they eat lunch together and talk about private matters that I'm not part of. I try to join the conversation, but I always feel like an outsider. It's so draining to feel alone for 8 hours every day. Good advice is welcome.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My girlfriend wants us to wear matching outfits
selftext:
Hi Brevkasse.
My girlfriend (since 6 months) has started a new thing: she wants us to have matching clothes when we go out.
Not just the same color, but sometimes exactly the same T-shirt.
At first it was a bit funny, but now she wants to do it every weekend.
My friends have started teasing me.
How do I say in a polite way that I would like to choose my own clothes, without making her sad?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents are trying to become TikTok stars
selftext: Help! My parents (both 50+) have discovered TikTok, and now it's all wrong. They are making dance videos in the living room and trying to get me in them. Yesterday my dad made a video where he lip-synced to a song and used a filter that gave him cat ears. It's so embarrassing. They have asked me to 'teach them the new trends'. How do I survive this?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss uses Comic Sans for EVERYTHING
selftext: I started my first real student job, and it's fine enough, but my boss insists on using the Comic Sans font for everything. Official emails to customers, internal reports, presentations. EVERYTHING. It looks so unprofessional, and it drives me crazy. Can I say something, or should I just learn to live with it?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: How do you leave a group chat in a polite way?
selftext: I am part of a group chat from an old school project. The project ended several months ago, but the chat is still super active. There are 100+ messages a day with memes and idle chatter. It drains my battery and my patience. Can I just leave the group without saying anything, or is that rude? What do you write if you need to say something?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I always get hiccups from spicy food
selftext: This is a bit strange, but every single time I eat something that is just a little spicy – chili, strong mustard, even pepper – I get hiccups. Not just a few hiccups, but a long, annoying bout. My friends think it's really funny. Is there a scientific explanation for it, and is there something I can do to avoid it (besides eating bland food)?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My roommate eats my food and denies it
selftext: I live in a dorm, and I'm pretty sure my roommate is eating my food. My Nutella jar empties faster, milk disappears, and yesterday a piece of my pizza from the previous evening was missing. When I ask him, he looks completely confused and says "it wasn't me". How do I handle this? Should I set a trap?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: Help, my houseplant is dying!
selftext: I bought my first houseplant to make my apartment cozier. It's a Pilea (a 'money plant'). I've followed all the instructions online: it doesn't get too much water, it sits in bright light, but not direct sunlight. Still, the leaves are drooping and look yellow and sad. What am I doing wrong? Is there a plant doctor here?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who block the entire sidewalk when they walk
selftext: Is there anything more irritating than a group of 3-4 people walking side by side at a snail's pace and filling the entire sidewalk? You can't get past them. You're forced to walk behind them at their pace or step onto the bike lane with your life on the line. Why don't people think about it? It's a small thing, but it ruins my morning every day.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is obsessed with his sourdough bread
selftext: During lockdown, my boyfriend started a sourdough starter. It was cozy at first. Now, two years later, it has taken over our lives. It has a name ('Børge'), it needs to be fed at precise times, and our entire kitchen table is covered in flour and strange tools. He talks more about rise times than about how my day has been. Is this normal?
label: Love & Dating

title: My little sister has 'borrowed' my clothes and posted them on Instagram
selftext: My 16‑year‑old little sister has been in my room while I was away and 'borrowed' my favorite dress. I found out because she posted a picture on Instagram of herself wearing it. She didn't ask permission, and now she has a stain on it. Our mother says I should 'be the adult'. But I'm furious! What should I do?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My friend wants me to help her cheat on the exam
selftext: My friend has asked if I would help her cheat on our upcoming online exam. She suggests that we sit together and do the assignment. I have read and prepared, but she hasn't. I don't want to cheat, and I'm afraid of being caught. But I'm also afraid of losing her as a friend if I say no. What should I say to her?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend has become a vegan and comments on everything I eat
selftext: My good friend recently became a vegan, which is completely fine with me. The problem is that he now comments on everything I eat. If I order a burger, he says 'do you know how it's made?'. If I drink milk in my coffee, he gives a little lecture about the cow industry. It's so exhausting. How do I get him to stop without criticizing his choice?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Is it weird that I'm afraid of balloons?
selftext: I have an irrational fear of balloons. The sound when they pop gives me a shock, and I can't relax at all if there are balloons in a room. It's a bit embarrassing, especially at birthdays. People always laugh at it, but for me it is truly uncomfortable. Are there others who feel the same, or am I the only one?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: How do you say no when friends ask if they can borrow money?
selftext: One of my friends asks quite often if he can borrow small amounts - 50 kr. here, 100 kr. there. He always pays back, but I'm just tired of being his personal ATM. It feels awkward to say no because they're not large amounts. How can I refuse in a way that doesn't ruin our friendship?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best way to remove a sticky price tag from a gift?
selftext: I bought a book as a gift, but I can't get the price tag off without it leaving a nasty, sticky residue or tearing the cover in pieces. I've tried peeling it off gently, but it always goes wrong. Is there a secret trick? Something with a hair dryer or oil? I need help before tomorrow!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Why can't people figure out how to use a supermarket checkout belt?
selftext: I go crazy in the supermarket. People pile their goods all the way up onto my shoulders, put their basket so you can't pass, and forget to put the product separator on the belt. It's as if common sense and consideration disappear as soon as people step into a Rema 1000. Is it really that hard?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My date ate his food in a really strange way
selftext: I was on a date yesterday, which was otherwise really cozy. But he ate his burger in a very... special way. He separated it and ate each part separately: first the top bun, then the salad, then the patty, and finally the bottom bun. The same with the fries, which he ate with a knife and fork. Is that a dealbreaker? I can't help but think about it.
label: Love & Dating

title: My grandmother always gives me the same 50 kr. as a birthday present
selftext: Every year on my birthday I get a card from my grandmother with a 50-kroner bill inside. I am 24 now. I know she means well, and I love her, but it feels a bit funny. It's the same gift I got when I was 10. Should I just smile and say thanks, or can I politely suggest that she doesn't need to give me money?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I ended up 'liking' a 2015 photo on my crush's Instagram
selftext: I'm completely done. I was stalking my crush on Instagram and scrolled way back. Suddenly my thumb hit the 'like' button on a photo of him from a vacation in 2015. I removed my like right away, but he probably got a notification. Should I message and joke about it, or just pretend nothing happened and hope he didn't see it?
label: Love & Dating

title: My dad has started wearing crocs – everywhere
selftext: My dad has discovered crocs. And now they are the only footwear he wears. In the supermarket, at family birthdays, when he was with me at the recycling center. He has even asked if he can wear them to my cousin's confirmation. I feel a little ashamed about it. Can someone say something, or is it his feet, his choice?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am afraid that I am the annoying one in my study group
selftext: We have just started a new study group, and I am afraid that the others think I am annoying. I might be asking too many questions, and I like that we have a clear plan. The others seem more relaxed. No one has said anything, but I get this feeling that they are a bit tired of me. Am I overreacting, or how can I find out?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend never invites me over to her place
selftext: I have a really good friend, but we always meet at my place, at a café, or in town. I have never been at her place, even though we have been friends for over a year. Every time I suggest it, she comes up with an excuse that she's busy. I've started to wonder if there's a reason for that. Is it weird?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I don't like 'small talk'
selftext: I am really bad at small talk. At the hairdresser, during lunch breaks at work, at parties... I have no idea what to say about the weather or weekend plans. I'd rather talk about something deeper or just stay quiet. But people think I'm grumpy or arrogant. Do you have any good advice on how to get better at the superficial chatter that you can't avoid?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it okay to use MobilePay to ask for 15 kr. back?
selftext: I paid for a cup of coffee for a friend yesterday. It was 15 kr. Is it too small to send a MobilePay request for that amount? I'm a student, so every penny counts, but I also don't want to seem stingy. Where is the line for when you ask for money back?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you get rid of garlic smell from your fingers?
selftext: I love cooking with garlic, but I hate that the smell sticks to my fingers for several days. I've tried washing them with soap, lemon, and even toothpaste. Nothing really works. Is there a magic trick that can remove the garlic odor instantly?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who clap when the plane lands
selftext: I was flying last week, and when the plane landed safely, half of the passengers started clapping. Why? Do they also clap for the bus driver when he arrives at the stop? The pilot is just doing his job. I think it's so strange. Am I the only one who feels that way?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is terrible at losing in board games
selftext: I love playing board games, but my boyfriend is a real bad loser. If he's about to lose, he gets angry and grumpy and starts saying the game is stupid. It completely ruins the fun for me. I've tried talking to him about it, but he just says he has a 'competitive gene'. Should I just stop playing with him?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents-in-law always give me socks as a gift
selftext: The last three years I've been getting socks from my parents-in-law for both Christmas and birthday gifts. Not special, cool socks, but just a gray 3-pack from the supermarket. I know you shouldn't be ungrateful, but it feels so impersonal. Is it a hint? Or are they just unimaginative? My girlfriend says I should let it go.
label: Family Dynamics

title: How do you handle a 'know-it-all' in the study group?
selftext: There is a guy in my study group who always thinks he knows best. He interrupts, corrects others, and explains things that everyone already knows. It's draining to listen to, and it creates a bad atmosphere because no one else dares to say anything. How can we politely get him to give space to the rest of us?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend only replies to my messages with a 'thumbs up'
selftext: I have a friend who almost consistently replies to my messages with a 'thumbs up' emoji. Whether I write a long question, or share something personal, I just get a thumbs back. It feels so dismissive. Is it just me over-interpreting, or is it an impolite way of communicating?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Can one become dependent on nasal spray?
selftext: I have been sick with a cold and used a nasal spray for a week. Now I am no longer sick, but my nose is still completely blocked unless I use the spray. I have heard that one can become dependent on it. Is that true? And how do I get out of it again? It's so annoying not being able to breathe properly.
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My landlord wants me to mow the lawn
selftext: I rent a studio apartment with a small garden. There is nothing in my lease agreement stating that I must maintain the garden. Now my landlord has started sending me messages that the grass is too long and that I should mow it. Can he require that of me? I don't even have a lawn mower.
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: Which deodorant actually works against sweat odor?
selftext: I feel like I've tried all the deodorants on the market, but none of them work all day. In the afternoon I feel uncertain whether I smell of sweat. I need a 'heavy duty' deodorant that can keep me fresh from morning to evening. Do you have a recommendation that actually keeps what it promises?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: I'm tired of ads that listen in
selftext: I am 100% sure that my phone is listening in on my conversations. Yesterday I was talking with a friend about cat food (I don't even have a cat), and now my entire Instagram feed is filled with ads for cat food. It's so creepy and intrusive. Is it legal? And is there anything one can do to stop it?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is at odds with my cat
selftext: I have a cat that I have had for several years. Half a year ago my boyfriend moved in, and he and the cat hate each other. The cat hisses at him and sometimes urinates in his shoes. My boyfriend ignores the cat or pushes it away. It's a terrible atmosphere at home. I love them both, what should I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: My mother always comments on my weight
selftext: Every time I see my mother, the first thing she says is something about my body. Either 'have you lost weight?' or 'you need to be careful not to gain weight'. It's always with a worried look. I am normal weight and feel fine with my body, but her comments make me insecure and sad. How do I get her to stop?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am the only one in the office who doesn't drink alcohol
selftext: I don't drink alcohol at Friday bars and company parties. It's just a personal choice. But my colleagues keep pressuring me. 'Can't you just have one?', 'It's boring when you don't drink with us'. I'm tired of having to defend my choice all the time. How do you handle the social pressure?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend copies my style
selftext: Lately, my friend has started copying me. She has bought the same jacket as me, dyed her hair in the same shade, and has even begun using the same phrases that I use. It's flattering, but also a bit creepy. I feel like I'm losing my own identity. Can I say something to her, or should I just let it be?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I get stomach pain from stress
selftext: During busy periods at school or work, I always get stomach pain. It's a crushing sensation, and sometimes I also feel nauseous. It's as if all my stress settles directly in my stomach. Are there others who experience this? And have you found anything that helps alleviate it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it dumb to spend money on an expensive fitness membership?
selftext:
I am considering signing up for a slightly more expensive fitness center that has a spa and better classes.
It costs twice as much as my current cheap membership.
My sense says it's a waste of money, but I think I might get more out of it if it's a nicer place.
What are your experiences? Is it worth the money?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best gift for an 18-year-old birthday?
selftext: My little brother is turning 18, and I have no idea what to give him. He wants money, but that's so boring. I would like to give him something more personal or an experience he can remember. The budget is around 500 DKK. Do you have any good ideas for the perfect gift for a young man stepping into the adult world?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Tourists who stop in the middle of Strøget to look at maps
selftext: I work close to Strøget, and every day it's the same battle. Families who suddenly stop in the middle of the crowd to unfold a huge city map or stare confused at their phone. Step aside, though! It creates a huge bottleneck and is a nuisance for everyone just trying to get through. Is it too much to ask for a little situational awareness?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My crush only communicates in memes
selftext: I am texting with a guy I’m pretty into. He’s sweet and funny, but he almost exclusively replies with memes. If I ask how his day has been, he sends a picture of a tired cat. If I tell a joke, he sends a GIF. I can’t figure out whether he’s genuinely interested or just bored. How do you interpret meme language?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents do not understand my need for privacy
selftext: I am 17 years old and live at home. My parents always come into my room without knocking. My mother has also 'organized' my drawers and read my diary. They say that as long as I live under their roof, they have the right to do so. But I feel that my boundaries are being completely crossed. Am I being unreasonable?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am afraid to raise my hand in class
selftext: Even though I often know the answer, I never raise my hand in class. I am afraid of saying something wrong and of the other students thinking I'm dumb. So I just sit and stay quiet, even though I want to participate. It affects my oral grade. Does anyone have good advice on how to overcome this anxiety?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: Is it okay to ghost a friend?
selftext: I have an acquaintance whom I've seen a few times. He's decent enough, but we have no chemistry at all, and I don't want to see him anymore. He keeps writing and inviting me out. Is it okay just to stop replying to him? Or do I owe him an explanation, even though we're not close friends? I hate confrontations.
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: My fingers 'sleep' all the time
selftext: Recently, my fingers (especially the little finger and ring finger) have started to 'sleep' quite often. It happens when I hold my phone, cycle, or sometimes just wake up in the morning. It's a tingling and numb sensation. Should I be concerned and see a doctor, or is it just a normal thing?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: How do you save when you're bad at it?
selftext: I really want to save up for a trip, but I'm terrible at it. Every time I get paid, it feels like the money just disappears on small things like coffee, lunch out, and impulse purchases. I've tried making a budget, but I never stick to it. Do you have a foolproof trick for someone who lacks financial discipline?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best way to boil an egg?
selftext: It sounds like a simple question, but I can never get it perfect. Either it's overcooked, or the yolk is completely runny. What is the secret behind the perfect smiling egg? How many minutes should it have? Should it be in cold or boiling water from the start? All tips are welcome!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Why do people leave their chewing gum under tables?
selftext: I ended up touching the underside of a table at a café today, and my hand was covered with an old, hard piece of chewing gum. It's so disgusting! Who does that? We're supposed to be taught to wrap it in a piece of paper and throw it in the trash can. It's the height of disrespect.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend doesn't like my friends
selftext: I have been with my boyfriend for a year, and he makes no effort to get to know my friends. When we are together with them, he just sits and looks at his phone. Afterwards he says that he thinks they are superficial. My friends are a huge part of my life. That can't work in the long run if he doesn't like them?
label: Love & Dating

title: My brother thinks he's an expert in everything
selftext: My older brother just read half an article online, and suddenly he's an expert on the subject. Whether it's politics, investing, or diet, he knows best. He lectures the whole family and refuses to listen to others. It's so exhausting to be at family gatherings. How do you deal with someone who is so arrogant?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I hate group work
selftext: I learn best when I work alone. But at my university almost everything is based on group work. I always end up doing most of the work because the others are irresponsible. Or there are endless discussions about trivial matters. Can I ask my instructor to do the assignment alone, or should I just accept that it is part of studying?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is a 'one-upper'
selftext: I have a friend who always has to outdo everything I tell. If I say I've had a busy week, he has had a MUCH busier week. If I tell him I've bought a new phone, he just ordered one that is much better. It's so exhausting that it always has to be a competition. Is that something you can talk to him about?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I always sneeze when I look toward the sun
selftext: Every time I go outside, and the sun is shining, I start sneezing. Usually 2-3 times in a row. My family experiences it the same way. Is it some kind of allergy? It's quite inconvenient, especially when driving. I've heard it's hereditary, but is there a real explanation?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it rude to ask guests to take off their shoes?
selftext: I would prefer not to have shoes inside, especially not in wet weather. But I find it awkward to ask guests to take their shoes off. Especially if they have put a lot of effort into their outfit. What is the general attitude in Denmark? Is it common courtesy to take them off, or is it the host's responsibility to accept shoes inside?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you get a zipper that is stuck to work again?
selftext: The zipper on my favorite jacket has gotten stuck. It won't go up or down. I've tried pulling gently, but I'm afraid of breaking it. Is there a trick to 'lubricate' it so it slides again? I've heard something about using a pencil. Does that work?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't put their weights back in the gym
selftext: I am so tired of people in the gym who use a lot of heavy weight plates and then just leave them on the bar or on the floor. It's bad manners and disrespectful to the next people who need to use the equipment. It takes two minutes to clean up after yourself. How hard can it be?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is friends with his ex on social media
selftext: I have discovered that my boyfriend still follows his ex on Instagram. He also likes her pictures from time to time. He says they ended on good terms, and that it doesn't mean anything. But I can't help feeling a sting of jealousy. Is it me who is insecure, or is it okay to ask him to remove her?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents still want to control my finances
selftext: I am 22 years old, have moved out of the house and have a job. Still, my parents want access to my online banking to "keep an eye on me using my money wisely." They interfere with my purchases and criticize me if I spend money on clothes or café visits. How do I set a boundary without seeming ungrateful for their help in the past?
label: Family Dynamics

title: How do you write a good application for a part-time job?
selftext: I am 16 years old and would like to get my first part-time job at a supermarket or a café. But I have no idea what to write in an application when I have no experience. What do employers look for? Should I just write that I am punctual and eager to learn? All tips are welcome!
label: Work, Study & Career

title: I am the only one in the friend group who doesn't have a driver's license
selftext: All my friends have gotten driver's licenses and cars. Now all their plans revolve around driving trips, and I feel a bit left out. I am the one who always has to ask if I can ride along, and I can't join the spontaneous trips. I can't afford a driver's license right now. How do you handle the feeling of being left behind?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I have social anxiety about talking on the phone
selftext: I hate talking on the phone with people I don't know. If I have to call the doctor or order a pizza, I get a racing heart and practice what I'm going to say several times. I always postpone it and end up writing an email if possible. It's so impractical. Is there anyone who has overcome phone anxiety?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Should I choose a fixed or variable interest rate on my SU loan?
selftext: I am going to take an SU loan to get everything running. But I am unsure whether I should choose a fixed or variable interest rate. I know nothing about finance. What are the advantages and disadvantages of the two? What would you choose if you were me?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best remedy against mosquitoes?
selftext: I get bitten alive by mosquitoes every summer. I get huge, itchy bites that drive me mad. I've tried mosquito spray and those plugs you put in the outlet, but nothing works 100%. What are your best, most effective weapons in the war against mosquitoes?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who use their phones in the cinema
selftext: There is nothing that can ruin a movie experience like the light from a mobile screen. Even though people dim the brightness, it is still incredibly disruptive in the dark. Why can't you put the phone away for two hours? It's so disrespectful to everyone else in the theater.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend hates my favorite movie
selftext: My absolute favorite movie is [insert fictional movie title], and I tried to show it to my boyfriend. He fell asleep halfway and later said it was the most boring movie he had ever seen. I know it's a small thing, but I was genuinely upset. Can you have a relationship with someone who has such bad taste in movies?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents forgot my birthday
selftext: I turned 20 yesterday. My friends celebrated me, but I heard nothing from my parents. No call, no message, no card. They've never forgotten it before. I'm hurt and disappointed, but I don't know whether I should say something to them. Should I call and remind them, or just see how long it takes before they notice?
label: Family Dynamics

title: Is it too late to change study track in high school?
selftext: I am in 2.g and have realized that I have chosen the completely wrong study track. I hate my subjects, and I can't see myself using it for anything. Is it possible to switch to another line now, or am I forced to continue and then just supplement subjects later? I am quite unhappy about it.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is passing on my secrets
selftext: I have told my friend something personal in confidence. Now I have heard from another friend that she has passed it on. I feel so betrayed and can no longer trust her. Should I confront her about it, or should I just let the friendship die out and stop telling her things?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I sweat a lot, even though it's not hot
selftext:
Even when I'm just sitting still in a cool room, I can start to sweat.
It's especially on my back and in my palms.
It's embarrassing, and I'm always worried about whether I smell, or whether it can be seen on my clothes.
Is there anyone who has experienced the same and found a solution?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I found 500 kr. on the street. What should I do?
selftext: I found a 500-kr bill lying and fluttering on the sidewalk. There was no one nearby, and no wallet or anything. What is the right thing to do? Should I hand it over to the police as found property, or can I just keep it? What would you do?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What do you do about a bicycle chain that keeps falling off?
selftext: My bike chain falls off at least once a week. It's always at the most annoying time, and I end up getting oil all over it. I've tried tightening it, but it doesn't seem to help. Is there a simple trick, or should I just send it to an expensive bike mechanic?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who stand in front of you in the bus queue
selftext:
Someone has been standing politely and waiting for the bus.
Then the bus arrives, the doors open, and suddenly a person who has just arrived pushes themselves in front of everyone else to get in first.
Where has politeness gone?
It's so disrespectful to those who have been standing and waiting.
Am I the only one who gets angry about it?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is a vegetarian, and I love meat
selftext: I just got a boyfriend who is a vegetarian. I eat meat and really enjoy it. Right now it's not a problem, but I'm worried about the future. How can we make it work in everyday cooking? Should we make two different dishes each evening? Are there other couples here with the same 'problem'?
label: Love & Dating

title: Should I force my child to give hugs to family members?
selftext: My 4-year-old daughter doesn't always want to give hugs to grandparents or other family members when we say goodbye. My mother gets offended and says that I should teach her to be polite. But I also want to teach my daughter that she decides for herself over her body. What is the right thing to do here?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am unsure about what to do after high school
selftext: I am graduating this summer and everyone asks what I will do afterwards. The truth is, I have no idea. I don't want to start a course immediately. Is it okay to take a gap year and just work and figure out what I want? I feel huge pressure to have a plan.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: I am always the one who writes first
selftext: In my friend group, it's always me who has to take the initiative. If I don't write in our group chat and suggest that we meet up, nothing happens. I get a bit tired of always having to be the one who gathers the troops. Does that mean they are not as interested in seeing me as I am in seeing them?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I can't sleep without 'white noise'
selftext: I have become dependent on sleeping with an app that plays 'white noise' (rain sounds, wind, etc.). If I don't have it on, I wake up at the slightest sound. Is it unhealthy for my ears to listen to it all night? And how can I get rid of it again?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it a bad idea to buy a sofa on installment?
selftext: I have found my dream sofa, but it is quite expensive. The store offers the option to buy it on interest‑free installments over 24 months. It sounds tempting, but I have also heard that such loans can be a trap. What are your experiences? Is it a good way to afford something you want, or is it a foolish financial decision?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: Good ideas for a lunchbox that isn't boring?
selftext: I am so tired of my dry rye bread sandwiches. I need inspiration for a lunchbox that is actually exciting to eat for lunch. It should be easy to make, and it must not require a microwave. What do you have in your lunchboxes? Share your best ideas!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Cyclists who run red lights
selftext: I am a cyclist myself, and I get so irritated with other cyclists who just run red lights. It is dangerous for them, for pedestrians, and for motorists. And it gives all of us other cyclists a bad reputation. How hard can it be to stop at a red light? It takes 30 seconds.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is a bad driver
selftext: I love my boyfriend, but I'm afraid to drive with him. He drives too fast, brakes too late, and gets angry at others on the road. I always sit with my heart pounding in my chest. I've tried telling him, but he just gets offended and says he has full control. What should I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: My grandma calls 10 times a day
selftext: My grandma is 85 and lives alone. She calls me constantly throughout the day, often just to ask the same thing she asked an hour ago. I love her, but I can't answer the phone when I'm at school or work. I feel guilty when I don't pick up. How do you handle that?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My internship supervisor gives me no tasks
selftext: I am in an internship, and I am terribly bored. My supervisor is nice, but she forgets to give me tasks. I just sit and stare at a screen most of the day. I have asked if there is anything I can help with, but she just says 'not right now'. I am learning nothing. What should I do?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: A friend has stopped inviting me to things
selftext: I have a friend whom I used to see a lot. But in the last six months he hasn't invited me to anything. I can see on social media that he still hosts parties and hangs out with our mutual friends. I asked if everything is okay, and he says 'yes, of course'. But something has changed. Should I just let it go, or should I ask more directly?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Why do my nails keep breaking?
selftext:
My nails have become really weak.
They split and break as soon as they get a little length.
I eat healthy and use hand cream.
Is this a sign that I am missing vitamins?
Or is there a miracle cure in the form of a nail polish or oil that can make them stronger?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My neighbor smokes, and the smell seeps into my apartment
selftext: My downstairs neighbor smokes inside, and the smoke seeps up through the floor into my apartment. The whole living room smells of old smoke. It's especially bad in the evening. I don't want to create a bad atmosphere. How do I bring up the conversation with him in a polite way? Is it even possible to ask people not to smoke in their own home?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you prevent your glasses from fogging up when wearing a mask?
selftext: Although masks are no longer required in most places, I still use them on public transport. But my glasses fog up immediately, and I can't see anything. I've tried placing the mask in different ways and putting it under the glasses. Nothing works. Do you have a trick that actually prevents it?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Why do shop staff say 'have a good day'?
selftext: I’ve noticed that almost all shop staff say 'have a good day' when you leave. Why not just say 'good day'? The word 'have' implies that I already had a good day, but what if I had a terrible day? It’s a small, silly thing, but it irritates me every time.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend talks in his sleep about penguins
selftext: My boyfriend has started talking in his sleep. It's not just mumbling; it's full sentences. The problem is that it's always about penguins. Last night he said: 'No, Klaus, give that fish back to the emperor!'. I know it's harmless, but it's also really weird. I've tried asking him about it, but he can't remember anything. Is it normal to have such specific sleep topics?
label: Love & Dating

title: My mom has added all my friends on Snapchat
selftext: Help. My mom (48) got Snapchat to 'keep up with the young world'. It was fine until I discovered that she had found and added all my closest friends. Now she sends them pictures of her garden with a flower-crown filter and writes 'Good morning, beautiful young people'. My friends think it's a bit funny, but I'm dying of embarrassment. How do I ask her to stop?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My colleague in the bakery is eating the cakes
selftext: I have a part-time job at a bakery. My colleague has a bad habit of 'tasting' the goods. A small piece of a raspberry roll here, a mouthful of a spandauer there. The boss hasn't noticed it, but I see it all the time. Technically, it's theft. Should I tell the boss, confront my colleague, or just pretend nothing happened? I don't want to be a snitch.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: Feeling like the only one who doesn't get an inside joke
selftext: In my friend group they have an inside joke about 'a Tuesday in Randers'. Every time someone mentions it, they all burst out laughing. I wasn't there when it happened, and no one will explain to me what's so funny. They just say 'it can't be explained'. I feel totally left out when it happens. Is that bad manners on their part?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I am afraid of swallowing chewing gum
selftext: Since I was little, I have had panic anxiety about swallowing my chewing gum. I have heard that story that it stays in the stomach for seven years. I know it probably isn't true, but the fear still lingers in me. If I am about to swallow it accidentally, I go into full panic. Are there others who have strange childhood fears that still cling on?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My roommate has labeled everything in the fridge with his name
selftext: I just moved into a college room with a new roommate. Yesterday I discovered that he has put small labels with his name on everything he owns in the fridge. The milk, the cheese, a half onion in a bag. Everything. It feels extremely passive-aggressive, as if he expects me to steal his food. Should I just ignore it, or should I make a joke out of it and put a name tag on my own cucumber?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to open a stubborn jam jar?
selftext: This is a cry for help. I'm standing here about to make pancakes, but I simply can't get the lid off the strawberry jam. I've tried with a damp cloth, banging it against the edge of the table, and holding it under the hot tap. The lid won't budge. Is there a secret trick that everyone knows except me? My breakfast depends on it!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't remove their lint from the dryer filter
selftext: I live in a property with a shared laundry room. Every time I need to use the dryer, the filter is filled with a thick layer of someone else's lint and hair. It's so disgusting, and it takes 10 seconds to remove. Why are people so indifferent to shared spaces? It's laziness at its finest.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: Date used a gift card on our first dinner
selftext:
I was on a first date yesterday.
The mood was good, and he was really sweet.
But when we had to pay, he pulled out a gift card that he had received as a Christmas present.
I was a little taken aback.
Isn't it a weird style to use a gift card on a first date?
I can't figure out whether it's frugal and smart, or just really tacky.
What do you think?
label: Love & Dating

title: My dad insists on fixing everything himself (and makes it worse)
selftext: My dad is convinced that he's a handyman. The problem is that he isn't. Every time something breaks at home – a dripping faucet, a creaky door – he throws himself at it with his tools. The result is almost always that the problem gets worse. The dripping faucet is now a gushing faucet. How do you convince him that it's okay to call a professional?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My teacher uses too many internal jokes that I don't get
selftext: My history teacher is probably a nice guy, but half of his teaching consists of internal jokes and references to old Monty Python movies. A few people in the class laugh loudly, while the rest of us just sit and look confused. It's hard to concentrate on the lesson when you feel like you've missed the point. Can I say something to him about it?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend has become obsessed with crystals
selftext: My best friend has started to get very into crystals and astrology. It's fine, but now it's the only thing she talks about. If I have a bad day, she says it's because 'Mercury is in retrograde', and that I should 'cleanse my energy with rose quartz'. I miss talking about normal things. How do I support her without going crazy myself?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Is it normal to be afraid of going down into the basement alone?
selftext: I am 17 years old, but I am still afraid of going down into our basement alone. Especially in the evenings. I turn on all the lights, run down to get what I need, and sprint back up the stairs. I know there's nothing there, but I still get this creepy feeling. Is it childish, or are there others who feel the same way about basements?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I have spent too much money on skins in an online game
selftext: I have ended up spending almost all my pocket money this month on buying skins and other items in Fortnite. At the moment it felt like a good idea, but now I regret it and can't afford to go to the cinema with my friends. I am ashamed to tell my parents. Do you have any advice on how to manage your spending in games?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best trick to remember people's names?
selftext: I am terrible at remembering names. At parties or at the start of a new school year I am introduced to a lot of people, and two minutes later all the names have disappeared from my brain. It is so embarrassing when I meet them again. Do you have any clever memory rules or tricks that work?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Why do recipes on the internet have to start with a whole novel?
selftext: I just want to know how long a chicken should be in the oven. Why do I have to first read a whole blog post about the author's childhood memories from a summer in Provence, and how the recipe has been in the family for generations? Just give me the recipe! There should be a 'jump to recipe' button on all food blogs.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is extremely picky and only eats food without 'clumps'
selftext: My boyfriend is the sweetest in the world, but he is extremely picky. He only eats food that has a uniform consistency. Stews, lasagna with meat sauce, fruit yogurt - everything with 'clumps' is excluded. He practically lives off pasta with ketchup and chicken nuggets. It's starting to get a bit boring to cook. Can you teach an adult man to eat normally?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents are embarrassing on social media
selftext: My parents comment on everything I post on Instagram. My mom writes things like 'My beautiful girl!' with 10 heart emojis, and my dad writes 'Nice picture. Say hi to cousin Lars'. They also comment on my friends' pictures. It's meant to be sweet, but it's also very embarrassing. How do I get them to stop without hurting their feelings?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My classmate smells of smoke
selftext: I have a new classmate in the class. He's pretty nice, but he smokes in all the breaks, and when he comes back in, his clothes and breath smell strongly of smoke. I almost get a headache from it. Can I say something to him in a polite way, or is it too sensitive a topic? I don't want to create a bad atmosphere.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friends are making a group chat without me
selftext: I have discovered that my closest friends have a separate group chat where I am not included. I happened to see it on one of their phones. I feel so hurt and left out. Why would they do that? Should I confront them about it, or should I just pretend nothing and be sad in secret?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I am the tallest girl in my class, and I hate it
selftext: I am a 15-year-old girl and almost 1.85 m tall. I am taller than all the girls and most of the boys in my class. I feel like a giant, and I always wear flat shoes so as not to appear even taller. People always comment on it. How do you learn to accept your height and be proud of it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My friends want to go to an expensive festival, but I can't afford it
selftext: All my friends are planning to go to Roskilde Festival this summer. They don't talk about anything else. I really want to go, but I simply can't afford the ticket. I'm embarrassed to say it, because it seems like everyone else has their finances under control. What should I do? Should I just tell the truth or come up with a bad excuse?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to avoid static clothing in winter?
selftext: Every winter I have the same problem. My clothes become static, so they stick to me and give me small shocks. Especially my scarf makes my hair completely electric. Is there a smart trick to avoid it? Something you can put in the washing machine or a special spray?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People standing in the way right in front of the exit on the train
selftext: When the train approaches the station, there is always a group of people who stand up and pile up against the doors, even though they are not supposed to get off. This makes it impossible for those of us who actually need to get off to exit. Why can't we wait for our turn until the train has stopped and people have gotten out? It's poor logistics and poor etiquette.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend hates my music taste
selftext: Every time I play my favorite playlist in the car, my boyfriend groans and asks if we could listen to something else. He calls my music "depressing indie noise". I love him, but it hurts me that he is so dismissive about something that means a lot to me. Can you ask your boyfriend to stop criticizing your music taste?
label: Love & Dating

title: My grandparents don't understand what a 'meme' is
selftext: I tried to show my grandmother a funny meme on my phone. She stared at it for a minute and then asked: 'Who is that cat, and why is it angry?'. I tried to explain the concept, but it only made it more confusing for her. Now she sends me pictures of random animals with the text 'Is this a meme?'. It's cute, but also a bit exhausting.
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss is my friend's mom, and it's awkward
selftext: I have gotten a part‑time job at a store where the boss is the mother of one of my good friends. It's so awkward. She treats me a bit like her own child and asks about my private life. And I don't dare say no to her, because I'm afraid it will affect my friendship. Is it a bad idea to work for your friends' parents?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My best friend has become a couple with my twin brother
selftext: My best friend and my twin brother have just become a couple. It's so weird. Now she's at all our family parties, and they are together all the time. I'm happy for them, but I also feel like I've lost both my friend and my brother a little bit. Is it normal to feel like that?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I am afraid of talking on the phone with strangers
selftext:
I hate having to call places. The doctor, the hairdresser, the pizza guy.
I get a racing heart, and I practice what I'm going to say before I call.
I always prefer online booking if possible.
It feels like irrational anxiety, but it is very real for me.
Is there anyone who has felt the same way and gotten over it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I have lost my wallet - what should I do?
selftext: I think I lost my wallet somewhere in the city today. All my cards are in it – Dankort, travel card, student card. What is the first thing I should do? Should I block all cards immediately? And is there any chance of getting it back if I report it missing to the police?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you keep your headphone cables from tangling?
selftext: Regardless of how neatly I roll the cable of my headphones together, it always ends up as a completely impossible knot when I take it out of my pocket or bag. I spend several minutes every day untangling it. Is there a magical trick to avoid it? It drives me mad.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: I don't understand people who like licorice
selftext: Honestly, how can someone like the taste of licorice? Especially salty licorice. For me it tastes like a mix of salt and chemicals. Still, most Danes love it. I feel like an alien every time someone offers Piratos. Am I the only one in the country who thinks it's a terrible taste?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is bad at replying to messages, but is always online
selftext: My boyfriend can take hours to reply to a simple message from me. But I can see on Snapchat and Instagram that he is online and active. That makes me insecure and irritated. Why can he see stories but not reply to my question? I have mentioned it to him, but he just says that he 'doesn't have the energy' to reply. Is that a bad excuse?
label: Love & Dating

title: My uncle tells the same bad joke at every family gathering
selftext:
Every. Only. Time.
We are gathered as a family, my uncle stands up and tells the same joke about a Norwegian, a Swede and a Dane. It wasn't even funny the first time.
We others send tired looks to each other, while he himself laughs loudly. Should we just let him do it, or can we politely say 'Uncle Børge, we've heard that one'?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am the only one who doesn't understand math in my class
selftext: It feels like everyone else in my math class gets it right away. The teacher explains, and they nod. I just sit and feel dumber and dumber. I don't dare ask questions, because I'm afraid the others will think it's a dumb question. Is there anyone who has good advice on how to get better at math when you feel completely lost?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend has started hanging out with a 'bad' clique
selftext: My best friend has started spending a lot of time with a group from school that has a pretty bad reputation. They cheat, smoke, and are generally pretty indifferent to everything. She has started to change and often cancels our plans to be with them. I'm worried about her, but I'm afraid she'll get mad if I say something. What should I do?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I eat when I'm bored
selftext: As soon as I get bored or just sit and watch a series, I automatically go to the kitchen to find something to eat. Even if I'm not hungry. It's just a bad habit that I want to stop. Do you have any good advice to avoid 'boredom eating'?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My parents don't give me pocket money
selftext: I am 15 years old, and my parents don't think I should have regular pocket money. They say they pay for everything I need. But I want my own money so I can decide what I want to spend it on, without having to ask permission to buy a soda. Is it unreasonable to expect pocket money?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: I have to give a speech for the first time - help!
selftext: I have to give a speech for my friend's confirmation, and I'm starting to panic. I'm not used to speaking in front of many people. What should I talk about? How does one structure a good speech? And what do you do if you freeze or start shaking? All tips for a nervous first-time speaker are welcome.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: I hate the sound of people cutting nails
selftext: Is there a sound that is worse than the little 'click' sound of a nail clipper? It gives me goosebumps. And it's even worse when people do it in public places like on the train or on a bench in the park. Why can't you do that kind of thing privately in your own bathroom? It's so disgusting.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: Feeling pressured to say 'I love you' first
selftext: I've been dating a guy for a couple of months, and I'm really happy with him. I can feel that he's close to saying those three little words, and I feel pressure to be ready to say them back. But I'm not quite there yet. What do you do if one is ready before the other? I don't want to hurt him by staying silent.
label: Love & Dating

title: My sister and I have to share a room, and she is super messy
selftext: My parents have decided that my little sister and I have to share a room to make space for a home office. I'm okay with sharing, but she is the messiest person in the world. Her clothes are everywhere, and she leaves plates on her desk. I'm very tidy. How can we make it work without becoming enemies every day?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am afraid to quit my part-time job
selftext: I have had a part-time job at a supermarket for a year, but now I want to stop so I can focus more on school. The problem is that I am afraid to quit. My boss is really nice, and I am afraid of disappointing her. What do you say? Should I say it in person, or is it okay to send an email?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: Two of my friends have become enemies, and I am stuck in the middle
selftext: My two best friends have become bitter enemies over a small thing. Now they refuse to be in the same room, and they both try to get me to pick a side. They speak badly about each other to me. It's a terrible situation. How can I be friends with both of them without being drawn into their conflict?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I got glasses and feel ugly with them
selftext: I just found out from the optician that I need glasses. I got them now, and I hate how I look with them. I feel nerdy and not like myself at all. Everyone says they are pretty, but I just think they're polite. How do you get used to having glasses and feel pretty again?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I ended up ruining something expensive that I borrowed from a friend
selftext: I borrowed a pretty expensive jacket from a friend for a party. During the evening I ended up spilling something on it, which has left a permanent stain. I am so embarrassed and upset. Should I offer to pay for a new jacket? I really can't afford it. How do you handle such a situation in the best possible way?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you prevent bananas from turning brown too quickly?
selftext: I love bananas, but I find that they turn brown and overripe almost immediately after I buy them. I've heard all sorts of tricks – that you should separate them, wrap the stem in film, etc. What actually works? What is the best way to store bananas so they stay fresh longer?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: Why does soda taste better from a glass bottle?
selftext: Is it just me, or does a Coca-Cola taste significantly better when it comes from a cold glass bottle compared to a plastic bottle or a can? There must be a scientific explanation. Is it something about the carbonation or the material? I can't be the only one who has thought about it.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My date checked her phone the whole time during the movie in the cinema
selftext: I was at the cinema with a girl yesterday. Midway through the movie she pulls out her phone and starts scrolling on Instagram. Not just a quick glance, but for several minutes at a time. The light from the screen was wildly distracting, and I thought it was so disrespectful. Is that a reason not to go on another date?
label: Love & Dating

title: My mother has become obsessed with genealogy and wants my DNA
selftext: My mother has gone all-in on genealogy. She has bought one of those DNA test kits, and now she wants me to take a test too so she can 'map the entire family's genetic origins'. I really don't feel like sending my DNA to a private company. She keeps pressing. Is it weird for me to say no?

title: My teacher is giving preferential treatment
selftext: There are a few students in my class whom my teacher apparently likes better than the rest of us. They always get more speaking time, receive praise for the smallest things, and are allowed to submit late. It's so obvious and unfair. It demotivates me completely. Can you do something about it, or should you just accept it?

title: I am secretly in love with my best friend
selftext: I am a girl and deeply in love with my best friend, who is a guy. We have known each other forever, and we can talk about everything. I am so scared to tell him that, because what if he doesn't feel the same? I don't want to risk ruining our friendship. But it's also hard to act like nothing when he talks about other girls. What should I do?

selftext: When I scroll through Instagram, I always feel worse afterwards. Everyone else seems to have a perfect life, be prettier, travel more, and have more friends. I know it's a glossy picture, but I can't help comparing myself. Do you have any advice on how to stop this bad habit?

title: My friend owes me money and acts like nothing
selftext: I lent a friend 200 kr. a month ago. He said he would pay back 'soon'. Now I've seen that he has bought new sneakers and dined out several times. He hasn't mentioned the money at all. It's awkward to ask for it, but I also think it's bad manners on his part. How do you ask in a relaxed way?

title: I have locked myself out of my apartment. What now?
selftext: I ended up slamming the door, and my keys are inside. My phone is also inside (I'm writing from my computer at a cafe). My landlord doesn't have his phone. Should I call a locksmith? I've heard they're super expensive. Are there other cheaper solutions? I'm a bit panicked.

title: I'm tired of getting ads for things I've just talked about
selftext: It's so creepy. I'm talking with a friend about going on a ski trip, and five minutes later my Facebook feed is filled with ads for ski trips and ski gear. My phone must be listening in. There's no other explanation. It feels like a huge violation of my privacy. Is it just me?

selftext: My boyfriend watches videos with the same YouTuber for hours every day. He constantly quotes him, has bought his merchandise, and talks about him as if they were best friends. title: I fell asleep in an online class. Did the teacher notice?
selftext: We had online lessons this morning, and I was so tired. I ended up falling asleep for about 20 minutes. My camera was on. I woke up with a start. Do you think the teacher or the others in the class noticed? I'm so embarrassed. Should I apologize, or just hope no one saw anything?

selftext: My childhood friend has started a new trend where every Thursday ('Throwback Thursday') he posts an old, embarrassing picture of me on Instagram and tags me. title: Is it worth the money to buy organic?

title: Tips for keeping your room tidy when you're a messy person
selftext: I am a chronic messy person. My room is always a chaos of clothes, books, and random things. I clean up, and two days later it looks like a war zone again. selftext: It is one of my pet peeves. People who start every sentence with 'i forhold til...'. 'In relation to the weather, it is good'. 'In relation to the food, it tastes fine'. title: How do you break up with someone who is *too* sweet?
selftext: I have a boyfriend who is the sweetest person in the world. He does everything for me, is always considerate, and has no bad sides. How do you handle that?

title: People who can't park within the spot

title: My boyfriend is secretly a fan of a 90s boy band
selftext:
I was rummaging through my boyfriend's old Spotify playlists and discovered a playlist that only contained songs by the Backstreet Boys.
Over 50 songs.

I think it's super funny and cute.

selftext: Very often when I stand up quickly from a chair or bed, it goes dark for my eyes, and I become completely dizzy for a few seconds. Is this normal? I've heard it might be something with blood pressure. Should I mention it to my doctor, or is it just a harmless thing that many experience?

selftext: Towards the end of the month, I consciously avoid checking my online banking. I'm afraid to see how little money is left. I know it's a dumb strategy, because I lose my overview. But seeing a low number stresses me. Are there others who have 'bank account anxiety'?

title: What is the best way to remove a sticker from a new book?

title: People who stand in the middle of an escalator

title: How do you balance homework, part-time jobs, and friends?

title: People who leave their shopping carts in the middle of the aisle

It's as if my mom has a sixth sense for when I'm most occupied.

I love her, but her timing is incredible.

I love him, but the sound is driving me crazy.

title: How to get the best seat in the cinema?

title: People who don't remove their empty coffee cups from the table at a café
