label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend has a tattoo with his ex's name
selftext: My boyfriend has a tattoo on his arm with his ex's initials. It's an old thing, and he says he wants it covered, but he never gets it done. It bothers me more than I want to admit. Every time I see it, I'm reminded of her. Can I allow myself to push for him to have it removed or covered?
label: Love & Dating

title: My little brother always eats the last piece of everything
selftext: No matter if it's cake, pizza or chips, my little brother always makes sure to take the very last piece. Without asking. It drives me crazy. I was looking forward to the last piece of chocolate cake, and now it's gone. Is this normal little brother behavior, or is he just selfish?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss wants me to be friends with him on Facebook
selftext: My new boss sent me a friend request on Facebook. I don't really feel like accepting it, because I use Facebook for private stuff with my friends. But I'm afraid it will become awkward at work if I ignore it. What do you do in such a situation?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friends have started speaking in 'code language'
selftext: In my friend group, they have started using a lot of abbreviations and internal expressions that only they understand. When I ask what it means, they just laugh and say 'it's a long story'. It feels like they are consciously excluding me. What's going on?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Why do you get a 'brain freeze' when you eat ice cream?
selftext: Every time I eat ice cream or drink a very cold slush ice too quickly, I get that intense, stinging headache right in the forehead. It only lasts a couple of seconds, but it hurts like crazy. What's happening in the brain? And is there a trick to make it go away faster?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it a bad idea to buy a used phone?
selftext: My phone is about to die, and I can't afford a brand-new one. I'm considering buying a used one online. Is it a good way to save money, or is it too risky? What should one be aware of, e.g., with the battery? And where can one find the most trustworthy sellers?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the easiest way to split an avocado?
selftext: I love avocados, but I always struggle to get the pit out. I'm afraid of cutting myself when I try to stab the knife into it. Is there a safe and easy method to open an avocado and remove the pit without getting hurt?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who watch videos on their phones without headphones
selftext: I was sitting on the train yesterday next to a man who was watching one TikTok video after another with full volume. The same annoying song over and over again. Why don't people think about how they are bothering everyone around them? It's so selfish. A pair of headphones costs almost nothing.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My partner is obsessed with counting calories
selftext: My partner has started counting calories in everything she eats. She weighs her food and inputs everything into an app. It's started to take up a lot of space, and it's not cozy to eat together anymore, because she always comments on how many calories are in my food. I'm worried whether it's becoming unhealthy for her. How do I talk to her about it?
label: Love & Dating

title: My dad has started using emojis incorrectly
selftext: My dad has just discovered emojis, and he uses them completely incorrectly. He sends the eggplant emoji when talking about dinner, and the crying-laugh emoji when he writes something sad. Yesterday he ended a message about our dog being sick with a wink-smiley. It's both confusing and a bit funny. Should I try to teach him what they mean?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My teacher cannot spell
selftext: My Danish teacher constantly makes spelling and grammar mistakes in the assignments he distributes and on the board. It's hard to take his teaching seriously. We are a group of students who have talked about it. Can we tell him in a polite way, or should we go to the administration?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is an 'energy vampire'
selftext: I have a friend who is always negative. Every time we meet, she complains about her job, her boyfriend, her family. I feel completely drained of energy after being with her. I want to be a good friend, but it's so heavy. How can I protect my own energy without rejecting her?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I always get goosebumps when I touch peach skin
selftext: This is really strange. I can't touch the skin of a peach. That fuzzy surface gives me goosebumps and gooseflesh all over my body. I can eat them if others have peeled them. Am I the only one in the world with peach phobia?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: How do you ask for a receipt if you paid with MobilePay?
selftext: I bought a used item from a private individual and paid with MobilePay. Now I would like to have some form of receipt for my purchase. How do you ask for it without it seeming like you don't trust the seller? Isn't the MobilePay transfer itself proof enough?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: Good advice on getting a cat to use its scratching post?
selftext: I bought a nice new scratching post for my cat. But she is completely indifferent to it and keeps scratching my sofa. I have tried spraying it with catnip and showing her how to do it. Nothing works. How do you convince a stubborn cat to use the scratching post instead of the furniture?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: I hate it when people say 'I'll get back to you'
selftext: Especially in professional contexts. 'I'll get back to you' is the most non-committal response in the world. It means everything from 'I'll reply in five minutes' to 'I intend to forget about this until you push for an answer in three weeks'. However, be specific! Tell when you will get back to me.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend loves ASMR videos, and I think it's creepy
selftext: Every evening my boyfriend falls asleep to ASMR videos on YouTube. The sound of whispering, tapping on objects, and mouth sounds fills our bedroom. He says it's relaxing. I think it's incredibly creepy and I can't sleep because of it. Is there a compromise here, or do I have to sleep with earplugs for the rest of my life?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents always compare me to my 'perfect' older brother
selftext: Whatever I do, my older brother is always better in my parents' eyes. 'Your brother got a 12 in that subject', 'Your brother was much better at football'. It's so demotivating, and it feels like I can never live up to their expectations. I've tried to tell them, but they think it's 'just as motivation'.
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss has bad breath
selftext: My boss is a good guy, but he has terrible breath. When he stands close and explains something, it's hard to concentrate on anything else. It's a very sensitive topic. Can you even do anything? Should you just hold your breath and suffer in silence?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is a 'planning dictator'
selftext: When my friend and I are going to do something, everything has to be planned down to the smallest detail. She creates a whole schedule for the day with times for everything. There's no room for spontaneity. If we are five minutes late, she gets stressed. I am much more relaxed. How can I get her to relax a bit without her thinking that I don't care about our appointments?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I can't stand seeing blood, not even in movies
selftext: I get dizzy and nauseous whenever I see even a little bit of blood. This applies both in real life and in movies. It's quite inconvenient, as it excludes a lot of films and series that my friends would like to watch. Is there a way to train myself to become less sensitive to it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it stingy to ask your guests to pay for takeaway?
selftext: I have a couple of friends visiting, and we have talked about ordering pizza. I am a student and don't really have the means to give pizza to three people. Is it okay to say 'Great idea, you can just send your share via MobilePay'? Or is it expected that the host pays for the food?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to avoid tears when chopping onions?
selftext: Every time I have to chop an onion, it ends up with my eyes watering, and it goes crazy. I've heard all sorts of home remedies: light a candle, take a sip of water, use goggles. What actually works? There must be a scientific trick.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who stand right in front of you in line because they 'just want to ask something'
selftext: I have been standing in line for 10 minutes. Then someone comes and pushes past everyone with the words 'I just want to ask something'. And then they end up having to exchange a product and have a long conversation with the cashier. It's not 'just'. Stand at the back of the line like all of us others. It's so cheeky.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend wants us to share a toothbrush to be 'environmentally friendly'
selftext: My boyfriend has become very environmentally conscious, which is great. But now he has suggested that we share a toothbrush to reduce plastic waste. He thinks that since we kiss anyway, it's the same. I think it's incredibly unhygienic and disgusting. Am I the one who's sensitive, or is his suggestion completely out of line?
label: Love & Dating

title: My mother-in-law is messing with my home when she visits
selftext: Every time my mother-in-law visits, she goes around moving my things. She straightens the pictures, rearranges the pillows on the sofa, and arranges the items on my bookshelf differently. She says she's "just helping to make it cozy". I think it's overstepping boundaries. How do I tell her to leave my things alone?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I ended up sending an email to the whole company that was only meant for one person
selftext: I was going to send a somewhat informal email with an internal joke to a colleague. I ended up clicking 'reply all' on a group email, so now the whole company (including the director) has received it. I'm sinking to the floor in shame. Should I send an 'apology' email afterward, or should I just hope people ignore it?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend imitates everything I say and do
selftext: I have a friend who has started acting like a copy of me. She uses the same expressions as me, has bought a copy of my bag, and always orders the same as me when we are at a café. At first it was flattering, but now it's just annoying. It feels like she doesn't have her own personality. What should I do?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I hate the feeling of certain textiles
selftext: I can't stand touching certain materials. Velvet, microfiber cloths, and wool give me an itchy feeling and a sense of discomfort. It's as if they 'stick' to my fingers. Are there others who have some kind of textile phobia? It's hard to explain to people.
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My friend wants me to invest in cryptocurrency with him
selftext: My friend has become completely absorbed by cryptocurrency and is convinced that he will get rich. Now he is trying to persuade me to invest my savings together with him in a new, unknown 'coin'. He says it's a 'sure winner'. I am very skeptical. Doesn't it sound like a really bad idea?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best trick to keep herbs alive?
selftext: Every time I buy a pot of basil or parsley at the supermarket, it dies within a week. I water it and put it in the light, but it always turns out sad and wilted. What is the secret to keeping those supermarket herbs alive for more than a couple of days?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who leave the toilet without washing their hands
selftext:
I was at a public restroom today, and the man in the stall next to me came out, looked at himself in the mirror, and went straight out the door.
Without washing his hands.
It's simply so disgusting and unhygienic.
Especially after the recent years.
How hard can it be to use 20 seconds with soap and water?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is too close to his mother
selftext: My boyfriend talks on the phone with his mother several times a day. She knows everything about our life, our arguments, our plans. He asks her for advice on everything. I sometimes feel like we are three people in our relationship. I have tried to talk to him about it, but he just says he has a good relationship with his mother. Where is the line?
label: Love & Dating

title: My little sister gossips about me to my parents
selftext:
Everything I tell my little sister in confidence she passes on to our parents.
She can't keep a secret at all.
That means I don't dare tell her anything personal anymore.
It's sad, because we used to be close.
How can I get her to understand that this destroys my trust in her?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My colleague sings along to the songs on the radio (but can't remember the lyrics)
selftext: At work, the radio plays all day. My colleague loves to sing along, but he never knows the lyrics. He just sings random words that sound a bit like the real lyrics. It's incredibly disruptive and sounds terrible. Should we just live in silence, or can we ask him to stop?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend always takes pictures of her food before we eat
selftext:
Every time my friend and I go out to eat, she has to take pictures of the food for her Instagram.
She spends several minutes finding the right angle while my food gets cold.
It drives me crazy.
Can I ask her to stop, or is that just part of dining out these days?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I always get an electric shock from everything in winter
selftext:
As soon as it gets cold and dry in the weather, I get shocks from everything.
Door handles, shopping carts, my cat.
They are small, unpleasant jabs.
Is there a scientific explanation for why it is worse in winter?
And is there a trick to avoid it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My roommate has an alarm that rings for an hour every morning
selftext:
My roommate is extremely difficult to wake up.
His alarm starts ringing at 6 a.m., and then he snoozes it every 10 minutes until 7 a.m., when he finally gets up.
I am awake from the first time it rings.
It totally ruins my sleep.
I have talked to him about it, but nothing changes.
What do I do?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best way to keep track of your passwords?
selftext: I have so many different passwords for all sorts of things, and I can never remember them. I always end up resetting my password. I know it's a bad idea to use the same one everywhere. Do you use a password manager app? Or do you have a smart system in a notebook? I need a solution.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't use headphones in the gym
selftext: I was at the gym yesterday, and a guy next to me was watching a movie on his phone with full volume. I was forced to listen in on the dialogue. Everyone else had headphones on. Why do some people think the whole center is interested in listening to their entertainment? It's so disrespectful.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: Is it a 'red flag' if your date is rude to the waiter?
selftext: I was on a date with a guy who was really sweet to me, but quite condescending and rude to the waiter. He was impatient and spoke in a commanding tone. I got a bad gut feeling. Is that a sign of how he really is? Or am I overreacting?
label: Love & Dating

title: My dad wants me to take over his old hobby
selftext:
My dad collected stamps when he was young.
Now he has dug up his old albums and wants me to take over the hobby.
He has bought a tweezers and a magnifying glass for me.
I think it's the most boring hobby in the world.
How do I politely say no without hurting him?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I ended up liking my boss's LinkedIn post
selftext: I was scrolling on LinkedIn and ended up liking my boss's post about 'synergy in leadership' by accident. Now I'm afraid he'll think I'm a sycophantic employee just trying to score points. Should I remove my like again, or would that be even more awkward? What is the LinkedIn etiquette here?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend always invites me to parties where I don't know anyone
selftext: My friend often invites me to parties at her other friends' places. The problem is that she then disappears and talks to all sorts of people, and I end up alone in a corner knowing no one. I feel like a social sidekick. Is it bad manners of hers not to stay with me, or should I just be better at talking to strangers?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Why does my foot fall asleep, and how can I wake it up fastest?
selftext: Sometimes if I've been sitting in a wrong position, my foot 'falls asleep'. It's a very unpleasant prickling and numb sensation, and I can almost not walk on it. What is happening in the body? And is there a trick to get the feeling back faster than just waiting?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it worth the hassle to collect bottle deposits?
selftext: My roommate collects all our bottles and cans in large bags and redeems them once a month. I think it gets messy and smells. I'd rather just throw them away. Are there really that many dollars to be made from the deposit that it's worth the hassle?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best remedy for a sunburned nose?
selftext: I was out in the sun yesterday and forgot sunscreen. Now my nose is bright red, swelling and completely sore. What is the best and fastest way to relieve a sunburn? Aloe vera? Cold cream? Good advice is welcome!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who record an entire concert with their phone
selftext: I went to a concert over the weekend, and the person in front of me held up their phone and filmed the ENTIRE concert. It ruined the view for everyone behind, and why would anyone want to watch an entire concert through a small screen? Be present in the moment, though. It's so annoying.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend hasn't deleted his dating profile
selftext: My boyfriend and I have been together for three months, and we have agreed that we are exclusive. A female friend told me that she saw him on Tinder the other day. I confronted him, and he said that he had just forgotten to delete the app. Should I believe him, or is this a huge 'red flag'?

title: My parents will not accept that I am a vegetarian
selftext: I have decided to become a vegetarian for the sake of animals and the environment. My parents think it's nonsense. My dad keeps offering me meat and jokes that I 'just eat grass'. It's hurtful and disrespectful. How can I get them to accept my choice?

title: My internship uses me as a free coffee maker
selftext: I am interning at a place where I had hoped to learn a lot. But my only tasks are to fetch coffee, make copies, and clean up after lunch. I feel like a free service worker. How can I politely ask to get some more relevant tasks?

title: I am the only one in the group who always has to drive
selftext: I am the only one in my friend group who has a car. Therefore it is always me who has to drive when we go out together. I am rarely offered gas money, and that also means I can never drink anything. I am getting tired of being the group's regular driver. How do I bring it up?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I can't stand the smell of coriander
selftext: For me coriander tastes and smells like soap. It's a terrible, perfumed taste that ruins all food. My friends love it and put it on everything. They say I'm picky. But I've read that it's genetic. Are there other 'coriander-haters' out there?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I received a parking ticket that I think is unfair
selftext: I received a parking ticket for keeping one wheel a little bit outside the curb. It was the only available spot, and the car next to it was parked crookedly. I think it's petty. Is it worth filing an appeal against such a ticket, or is it a waste of time?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to get sand out of everything after a beach trip?
selftext: I love being at the beach, but I hate that you have sand everywhere for several days after. In the bag, in the car, in the bed. It feels like it multiplies. Is there a genius trick to remove sand efficiently before you go home?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who stand too close to someone at the ATM
selftext: When you stand and need to withdraw money, why do people feel the need to stand just behind you and look over your shoulder? Give me some space, though! It's both a matter of privacy and security. There should be a discretion line at all ATMs.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is jealous of my friends
selftext: My boyfriend always gets a little moody and quiet if I say I'm going to have a girls' night with my friends. He doesn't say anything directly, but I can feel that he doesn't like it. He's afraid that we 'talk badly about him'. It's so exhausting to have to defend that I need time with my friends. What do I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents have my location turned on in 'Find My iPhone'
selftext: I am 19 years old, but my parents still insist on having my location turned on in 'Find My iPhone'. They say it's for my safety. But I feel monitored. The other day my dad called and asked why I was at a particular place. Is it reasonable for them to keep track of everything I do?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am afraid of taking a break from my studies
selftext: I am completely overwhelmed in my studies and really need a break. I am considering taking a half-year leave. But I am afraid that I will never come back and finish it. Is there anyone who has taken leave and has good experiences with returning?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: I am the 'mom', who always has to keep track of everything
selftext: In my friend group, it's always me who is the responsible one. I am the one who books the table, keeps track of the tickets, and makes sure everyone gets on the right train. I'm tired of being the group's project manager. How can I get the others to take a bit more responsibility?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: My ears become red and hot for no reason
selftext: Sometimes, out of the blue, one of my ears (always just one) suddenly turns flaming red and burning hot. It lasts for about half an hour and then disappears again. It happens whether I'm stressed or relaxed. What's going on? It's pretty strange.
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it a bad idea to have a joint economy with your partner?
selftext: My partner and I are considering opening a joint account, where we both transfer money for fixed expenses and food. Is it a good idea when you are young and not married? What are the advantages and disadvantages? I'm a little afraid of losing my financial independence.
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you prevent your black clothes from turning gray and fading in the wash?
selftext: All of my black T-shirts and pants quickly fade and look gray after I've washed them a few times. I wash them on low heat and with the wrong side out. Still, they lose their color. Do you have a secret washing trick to keep black clothes truly black?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who press the button at the pedestrian crossing multiple times
selftext: It won't turn green any faster if you keep hammering the button at the pedestrian crossing 20 times. The system has registered your press. All you achieve is making an annoying click sound for everyone else waiting. But have a little patience.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend doesn't like my pets
selftext: I have two cats that I love everywhere on earth. My new boyfriend is not an 'animal person'. He ignores them and complains that there is cat hair everywhere. He has even suggested that I could find a new home for them. That will never happen. Can a relationship work when one partner doesn't like the other's pets?
label: Love & Dating

title: My dad always gives me 'good advice' about my driving
selftext: I just got my driver's license. Every time I drive with my dad, he comments on everything. 'You brake too late', 'Why didn't you shift gears there?', 'Keep more distance now'. I get so nervous and insecure. I know he means well, but it doesn't help at all. How do I get him to stop?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss asked me to make coffee because I am the only woman
selftext: We were supposed to have a meeting at work, and my boss looked at me and said: 'Would you be so kind as to make a pot of coffee for us?'. I am the only woman in the department. My male colleagues were never asked. I was so stunned that I just did it. But I am furious about it. Should I say something to him?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend lies about small, trivial things
selftext: I have a friend who embellishes the truth all the time. She lies about small things, like what she did over the weekend, or whether she has seen a particular movie. They are not big lies, but it's strange, and it makes me doubt whether I can trust her with bigger matters. Why does she do that?

title: I have a habit of talking to myself
selftext: When I'm alone, I often talk to myself. I review my day, rehearse conversations or comment on what I'm doing. I just discovered that my roommate heard me doing it the other day. It's so embarrassing. Is it normal to talk to yourself, or am I going crazy?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: I found an error on my receipt - to my advantage. What should I do?
selftext: I just went shopping and discovered, when I got home, that the cashier had forgotten to scan a fairly expensive item. Should I go back to the store and pay for it? Or should I just be happy about my lucky mistake and leave it? What would an honest person do?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to remove wax from a tablecloth?
selftext: We had dinner yesterday, and wax from a candle has dripped onto my pretty white tablecloth. How do you remove it? I've heard something about an iron and coffee filters, but I'm afraid of making it worse. What is the best and safest trick?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't take their backpacks off in a packed bus
selftext: When the bus is full, why don't people take their huge backpacks off? They occupy the space of a whole person and constantly bump into other passengers every time they turn around. Take it off and put it between your legs. It's common courtesy.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is a 'backseat driver'
selftext: When I drive, and my boyfriend is the passenger, he comments on everything. 'You could have passed that', 'I would have taken the other way'. He even steps on an invisible brake pedal. It's so stressful to drive with him. How do I get him to relax and trust that I can drive well?
label: Love & Dating

title: My parents won't let me lock the door to my room
selftext: I am 16 years old, and I would like some privacy. But my parents say that I am not allowed to lock the door to my room because 'we are a family, and we have no secrets from each other'. They just burst in. I think this is an infringement of my boundaries. Don't I have the right to lock my door?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I'm tired of having to 'network'
selftext: At my university, everyone talks about how important it is to network. But I hate it. I think it's so fake and awkward to have to go around to events and try to 'sell yourself'. Can't you just get a job because you're good at what you do? Do you really have to play the social game?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is chronically late
selftext:
I have a friend who consistently arrives late.
Not just five minutes, but often half an hour or more.
It doesn't matter what we are doing.
She always has an excuse.
I'm getting tired of wasting my time waiting for her.
It feels disrespectful.
Can I say something to her?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I am afraid of riding the elevator alone
selftext: I always take the stairs if I can, because I hate riding the elevator alone. I'm afraid it will get stuck. I know it's irrational, but I get a racing heart just at the thought. Are there others who have claustrophobia in that way?

title: Is it a good idea to share a streaming subscription with a friend?
selftext: My friend and I are considering sharing a Netflix subscription to save money. Is it a good idea? Are there any disadvantages, e.g., with the number of screens you can watch on simultaneously? And what do you do if one suddenly doesn't want to be part of it anymore?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How to clean the screen on your computer or phone most effectively?
selftext: My computer screen is full of dust and grease fingerprints. What is the best and safest way to clean it without scratching or damaging it? Should you use a special cloth or liquid? Or is a dry cloth enough?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who leave meetings to 'take an important call'
selftext: I am so tired of colleagues who, in the middle of a meeting, suddenly stand up and leave the room because their phone is ringing. It is disruptive and signals that the call is more important than the meeting and everyone else's time. However, put your phone on silent and call back later. That is normal meeting culture.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is obsessed with his phone
selftext:
My boyfriend pulls out his phone as soon as we have a free moment.
In the bus, in the supermarket queue, even while we watch a movie.
I feel he is never really present.
I just miss sitting and looking out the window together or talking.
How do I bring up the topic without sounding like a grumpy, tech-averse boomer?

title: My stepmother gives me gifts that are obviously secondhand gifts

I'm pretty sure she gives me gifts that she herself has received but doesn't want. Should I just smile and say thank you, or can I say something?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I have started calling my teacher 'Mom'
selftext: The most embarrassing thing just happened. I raised my hand to ask a question, and I started the sentence with 'Mom, can you...'. The whole class heard it and laughed. I wish the earth would swallow me. How do I get over this embarrassment? I have to have her for the rest of the year.
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend has started dating my female friend's ex-boyfriend
selftext: The situation is complicated. My good friend has started seeing my good female friend's ex-boyfriend. They broke up half a year ago, and my female friend is still upset. Now I'm stuck in the middle. My female friend is angry, and my friend doesn't understand the problem. What are the unwritten rules here?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: My hands shake when I have to do something precise
selftext: When I have to do something that requires a steady hand, such as taking a picture, pouring something into a glass, or inserting a key into a lock, my hands start to shake. It's so annoying. It's not because I'm nervous. Are there others who experience this?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: How do you say no when a street vendor stops you?
selftext: I am bad at saying no, so I always end up in a 10-minute conversation with a street vendor from a charity organization. I don't want to sign up for anything. What is the most effective, yet still polite, way to end the conversation and move on?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you get ants out of your apartment?
selftext: There has come a whole army of ants into my kitchen. They march in a long line across the floor. I have tried to wipe them up, but new ones keep coming. Is there a household tip or a remedy that can effectively get them to disappear? I am going crazy.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't use turn signals at a roundabout
selftext:
My biggest frustration in traffic.
People who drive into a roundabout and leave it again without signaling right.
You hold and wait to be able to enter because you think they will continue around.
It's a waste of everyone's time and creates dangerous situations.
How hard can it be to use that little lever?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend wants us to go on an 'active holiday', and I just want to lie by the pool
selftext: We need to plan a summer holiday. My boyfriend wants to go hiking in the mountains and cycle long rides. I dream of lying on a sun lounger with a book and a drink for 14 days. We are fundamentally at odds about what a good holiday is. How do we find a compromise so that we both get a good trip?
label: Love & Dating

title: My grandfather has started telling racist jokes
selftext: My grandfather is from another generation, but lately he has started telling some really inappropriate and racist jokes when the family is together. It creates an incredibly awkward atmosphere. No one dares to say anything to him. Should we just ignore it because he's old, or should we speak up?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am the only one on my team who hasn't been abroad
selftext: At my university it seems like everyone else has been traveling during their gap year – in Asia, South America, etc. I just worked and saved up. Sometimes I feel a bit boring and inexperienced compared to them. Is it a must to have been on a long trip to be interesting?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My friend is a 'flake'
selftext: I have a friend who is super sweet, but she is a 'flake'. She cancels our appointments at the last minute with a vague excuse, or she just doesn't show up at all. It's so frustrating and disrespectful towards my time. I'm getting tired of it, but I care a lot about her. What do I do?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I am afraid of swallowing pills
selftext: I simply cannot swallow pills, not even small pain pills. I get a feeling that it gets stuck in my throat, and I panic. That means I always have to crush them or take liquid medicine, which is quite inconvenient. Has anyone had the same problem and found a trick to overcome it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My neighbor has posted a note saying that I am too noisy
selftext: There was a note hanging in the hallway today, addressed to 'the resident in 2nd floor', stating that my music is too loud in the evening. I am embarrassed, but also irritated that they didn't just knock on my door. I don't even play very loudly. How do I handle this? Should I go down and apologize?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: What is the best way to store leftover pizza?
selftext: How do you store pizza leftovers so that they remain tasty the next day? If I put them in the fridge in the container, the crust gets soggy and bland. Should each piece be wrapped in foil? And what is the best way to reheat them? Oven, pan, or microwave?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who don't give up their seat on the bus to the elderly
selftext: I saw a young, fresh person sit down on the bus today, while an elderly lady with a cane had to stand up. It makes me so angry. Where has the ordinary humanity and respect gone? It should be a given to stand up for someone who clearly needs the space more.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My girlfriend is on an endless diet
selftext: My girlfriend is always trying a new diet. Keto, paleo, fasting... It's impossible to keep up. That means we rarely get to eat the same thing, and she constantly talks about what she 'may' and 'may not' eat. It's become an obsession. I'm worried about her. How can I support her without encouraging unhealthy behavior?
label: Love & Dating

title: My mom FaceTimes me without notice
selftext: My mom has discovered FaceTime, and she now always calls on video without texting first. It's often at the most inconvenient times, when I'm just waking up or sitting on the bus. I'd rather just have a normal call. How can I get her to understand that one should ask before calling on FaceTime?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss sends me tasks right before the end of my shift
selftext: My boss has a habit of bringing a 'small, quick task' ten minutes before I am off. The task is never small or quick, so I always end up having to stay longer. It feels like poor planning on his part. Can I say that I will do it tomorrow, or is it expected that I stay?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: Is it okay to think that a friend's baby is not cute?
selftext: My friend just had a baby, and everyone says it's 'sooo cute'. Honestly, I think it looks like a little, sour potato. I feel like a terrible person. Is it normal not to think that all babies are adorable? Of course I act like I think it's the cutest in the world.
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I have trouble saying 'r'
selftext: I have always had trouble pronouncing 'r' correctly. It's not a big problem, but I'm aware of it, and I sometimes avoid words with many 'r's in them. I feel a bit childish because of it. Is it something one can train out of as an adult, or is it just the way I speak?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: Is it a bad idea to rent out an apartment on Airbnb?
selftext: I will be traveling for a month in the summer and am considering renting out my apartment on Airbnb to earn a little extra. Is it a good idea? I'm worried that my belongings might be stolen or damaged. What are your experiences with it? Is the hassle worth it?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you avoid getting shocks from a shopping cart?
selftext: Every time I'm down to shop, I get small, annoying shocks from the metal parts of the shopping cart. It's especially bad in winter. Why does this happen? And is there a trick to avoid it? It's starting to give me a phobia of shopping.
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who slow down to look at an accident
selftext: There's been a small traffic accident in the opposite lane. No one was injured. Still, all the cars in my lane slow down to crawl speed to stare. It creates a huge queue that is completely unnecessary. Keep driving! It's disrespectful to those involved and annoying to everyone else.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend watches porn every day
selftext: I completely lost feelings for my boyfriend over three years when I saw his browsing history. He watches porn almost daily. When I confronted him about it, he said it was completely normal and nothing to worry about. I feel inadequate and betrayed. Am I paranoid, or is it a sign that something is wrong in our relationship?
label: Love & Dating

title: My brother borrows my stuff without asking
selftext: My 19-year-old brother just walks into my room and 'borrows' my stuff without asking – headphones, jackets, and even my gaming headset, which he destroyed. He doesn't think it's a problem because 'we're family'. I get so irritated. How do I get him to respect my boundaries?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am overqualified for my job
selftext: I have a master's degree, but I work as a receptionist. My boss keeps saying that it's just a 'transition', but I've been here for three years now. I don't feel that I'm developing professionally at all, and that makes me depressed. Should I find a new job, or should I try to fight for a position with more responsibility, where I am now?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: I get social anxiety at parties
selftext: When I arrive at a party, I usually go straight to the bathroom or hide behind my phone. I have no idea how to start a conversation with people I don't know. Even though I'm out with friends, I feel completely alone. Do you have any tips on how to become more relaxed in social situations?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I think I'm allergic to my new job
selftext: Shortly after I started my new job, I began to develop rashes and headaches every day. My doctor thinks it could be psychosomatic stress from the work, which is extremely pressured. Should I quit, or am I just sensitive?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My husband does not want more children
selftext: We have a 3-year-old son, and I really dream of having another child. But my husband says 'never again'. The birth was hard for me, but I've dreamed of a big family since I was little. I don't know if I can accept his decision, or if it will end up ruining our relationship.
label: Family Dynamics

title: How do I get rid of banana flies?
selftext: There is one single, annoying banana fly that has been bothering me for three weeks now! I have cleaned everything, thrown out all fruit, and set up traps – nothing works. It's a small thing, but I'm starting to go crazy. Help!
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who talk loudly on the phone in the bus
selftext: Why do some people think it's okay to have a loud phone conversation in a packed bus? We others are forced to hear about their privacy. 'Yes, and then I said to Birgitte...' I don't care! Write a message like all of us others.
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: Should I meet my ex?
selftext: My ex wrote yesterday and asked if we should meet to 'talk'. We broke up half a year ago, and it was not nice. My new boyfriend (we have been together for 2 months) is absolutely against me meeting her. I am uncertain – what if there are still feelings?
label: Love & Dating

title: My father threatens to make me illegitimate
selftext: My parents are divorced, and my father has always been difficult to deal with. The last time I visited him, I told him that I didn't vote for the same party as him. He got furious and said he would make me illegitimate. I'm in shock. Am I overreacting when I'm hurt by it?
label: Family Dynamics

title: I am panically anxious about the exam
selftext: My exam is in two weeks, and I am starting to panic and cannot sleep. I have studied, but I am convinced that I will fail anyway. My brain shuts down completely when I get stressed. How do I overcome exam anxiety?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: My best friend is getting married, and I can't afford to go
selftext: My best friend is having her wedding somewhere abroad, which I simply cannot afford to travel to. She didn't even ask if it was possible for me – she just assumed I could pay to be there. I'm really sorry. Should I tell her, or just accept it?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: I get the craziest hangovers
selftext: Even though I only drink 4-5 beers, I wake up with the worst hangovers. My friends can drink twice as much without problems. My doctor just says I should drink more water, but that doesn't help. Are there others who have tried it?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My friend borrows money without paying it back
selftext: My friend borrowed 500 kroner from me two months ago. I gently reminded her about it once, but she ignored it completely. I can't just afford to write the money off. How can I get them back without ruining our friendship?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: Are we ready to have children?
selftext: My husband and I have been married for a year, and he thinks it’s time to have children. I’m only 24 and don’t feel ready at all. I want to experience more before we start a family. He says I can’t keep putting it off. How do we find a compromise?
label: Family Dynamics

title: How do you remove wood splinters from a carpet?
selftext: My floor carpet is filled with small wood splinters after we installed door jambs. I have vacuumed and swept, but nothing works. Is there anyone who knows a trick to get them out?
label: Practical Questions & Everyday Life

title: People who send long voice messages
selftext: My mother and grandmother have started sending me long voice messages on WhatsApp. It's completely absurd – why not just write? The sound quality is bad, and half of what they say is incomprehensible. Why do older people do that?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: My boyfriend is jealous of my girlfriends
selftext: My boyfriend gets jealous every time I go out with my girlfriends. He thinks I spend more time with them than with him. I feel I constantly have to defend my friendships. It drains me of energy, and I lose the desire to see them. What should I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: My son wants to shave his eyebrows
selftext: My 12-year-old son wants to shave his eyebrows, 'just like they do on TikTok'. I think it's a completely ridiculous idea. He says that I don't understand him at all. Should I give him permission, or should I stand firm?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss is bullying me
selftext: My boss is bullying me in a passive-aggressive way – she ignores my input to meetings and gives others the credit for my work. It's starting to break me mentally. I don't have the energy to confront her. Should I just quit and find something new?
label: Work, Study & Career

title: I am gay, but my family doesn't know
selftext: I live a double life. My family thinks I am heterosexual, but I am attracted to men. I cannot tell them to my strongly religious parents – it would ruin everything. How long can I keep it hidden? I am 18 and just want to live my life.
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boyfriend still lives at his parents' house
selftext: My boyfriend is 28 years old and still lives at home. He does not help around the house; his mother does everything for him. We have been together for two years, and he never mentions moving. I cannot see a future with a man who cannot take care of himself. What should I do?
label: Love & Dating

title: How to support a female friend with depression?
selftext: My closest friend has just been diagnosed with depression. I want to do everything to help, but I don't know what to say or do. I'm afraid of saying something wrong. Do you have any advice on how I can support her in the best possible way?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: My boyfriend seems uninterested in my life
selftext: When I tell my boyfriend about my day at work, he yawns or looks at his phone. I don't feel he listens at all. But when his friends are visiting, he is full of energy and chatter. Have I just become boring?
label: Love & Dating

title: I get winter depression every year
selftext: From November to February I become completely energy-depleted. The gray, dampy weather makes me just isolate myself at home and feel bad. I have tried light therapy, but it doesn't really help. Is there anyone who has found a solution to winter depression?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: My husband refuses to buy items on sale
selftext: My husband spends thousands of kroner on things he doesn't need, but gets angry if I buy something on sale. 'There are ALWAYS sales,' he says. But I'm saving the family money! How do I get him to understand?
label: Personal Finance & Housing

title: How do you avoid becoming lonely?
selftext: I am 35, single and have no children. Most of my friends are married and busy with their careers and family. I feel left out and afraid of ending up as 'the crazy cat lady'. Are there others in the same situation? How do you handle it?
label: Friendship & Social Life

title: How much skincare is too much?
selftext: My friend spends 45 minutes every morning on her skincare routine – 10 different products. I just use a facial wash and a moisturizer. She says I'm ruining my skin. Is she hysterical, or do I need a more advanced routine?
label: Health & Wellness (Physical and Mental)

title: People cycling on the sidewalk
selftext: Cyclists who come thundering onto the sidewalk at full speed without ringing the bell. One barely has time to jump for one's life. There is a bike path right next to it! Why should the sidewalk be used as their personal race track?
label: Everyday Observations & Rants

title: I have become a vegan, and my family is furious
selftext: I have decided to become a vegan, and my family has gone crazy. My mother is convinced that I will die of protein deficiency, and my brother calls it a 'modern dill'. I just don't feel good about eating animals anymore. How do I get them to respect my choice?
label: Family Dynamics

title: My boss asks too much about my private life
selftext: My boss constantly asks about my love life, my family situation, and my finances. It feels inappropriate, but he's my boss, so I answer politely. I feel my boundaries are being crossed. How can I get him to stop?
label: Work, Study & Career
